thread.title: Mattias Janmark scores on his first shot for the second straight game
thread.title_full: Mattias Janmark scores on his first shot for the second straight game | Dallas Morning News

author: Mike Heika
title: Mattias Janmark scores on his first shot for the second straight game
text:
DENVER -- Rookie Mattias Janmark has scored on his first shot in each of his first two NHL games.
Janmark scored 1:39 into the first period Thursday in a 3-0 win over Pittsburgh.
Then, Saturday, he scored 20 seconds in against Colorado.
Janmark took a deft pass from Jason Demers in transition and slipped a backhand under Semyon Varlamov for his second goal of the year.
Janmark said he hasn't felt overwhelmed by NHL play.
"I wasn't as nervous as I thought I'd be," he said. "Playing the preseason games was almost like playing a regular season game. I guess I kind of learned from that. I played a few years of pro in Sweden, too, so I've played in front of crowds. But of course, you don't know what to expect. When you get a start like that, it's easy to shake those nerves off and I think you play better when you get a start like that."
